intro: Erigeron bovei, commonly known as the Bove's fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It produces small, white to pale blue flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Erigeron bovei is often found in disturbed soils and is adapted to arid environments.
